ME3000 Tutorial

The ME3000 enhances the capabilities of the ME2000 by introducing the ability to load and play MobileXMF files, which may include MobileDLS instrument definitions to supplement the standard GM instrument set. To accommodate this, three new APIs have been added to the Mobileer system:

  • the DLSParser API, to allow you to load DLS instruments into the Mobileer engine;
  • the XMFParser API, to allow you to utilize MobileXMF files, and
  • the SongPlayer API, to allow simple loading and playback of either SPMIDI or MobileXMF files.

The DLS Parser and XMF Parser allow you low-level control over the loading and interpretation of MobileXMF. If you just want to play a file (MIDI or MobileXMF) without worrying about parsing details, you should use the SongPlayer API.

Using the SongPlayer API

To load and play an SPMIDI or MobileXMF file that you've loaded into RAM, you need to follow the steps below:

  1. Start the MIDI Playback engine.
  2. Create a SongPlayer context structure.
  3. Start the SongPlayer.
  4. While there's still data to play, generate a buffer's worth of audio and play it.
  5. Stop the SongPlayer, delete the context and stop the engine.

An example of SongPlayer use can be found in the release, in /examples/play_song.c.
